_header: Upon the cross nailed was I for thee
Title(s): Why artow froward sith I am mercyable? (Lydgate)
Subjects: Christ, complaint to man; carols, of Christ’s pleading; envoys; dialogues, Christ and man
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Why artow froward sith I am mercyable?’ — five 8-line stanzas, including one-stanza envoy and one-stanza ‘oracio’ (formerly 1967.5) and refrain ‘Why artow froward sith I am mercyable?’

BodHat73.First Lines:
LOrd an alle synful here knelynge on ther kneThi pasioun Remembryng
                    with humble affection…
BodHat73.Last Lines:
…Now for thi moder is meke mediacion At oure requeste be to vs
                    mercyable

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Up on the cros naylled I was ffor thesuffred deth to paye thy
                    raunsoun…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…now for thy modris meek mediaciounat hir request be to us
                    mercyable
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title:
HEre crist Ihesu seith thus on to man as he hangeth vp on the roode tre (f.
                        14v)
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 252-4.

BodLauMis598.First Lines:
Vpon the crosse naylyd was for þeSuffrid deth to pay thy
                    Raunsom…
BodLauMis598.Last Lines:
…Now for moderis meke mediationAt hir request be to vs
                    merciable

BodRawPoe32.First Lines:
Apon a crosse nayled I was for theSuffred deth to pay thi
                    raunsoun…
BodRawPoe32.Last Lines:
…Now for thi modrys meke mediticiounAt this request be to vs
                    merciable

OxfStJohn56.First Lines:
…Thenk a geyn pride on my[ ]Come to scole recorde we[
                    ]…
OxfStJohn56.Note:
A torn fragment (fragments of the text of 14 ababbcbc
                    stanzas)

CULHh412.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Political, Religious and Love Poems, from Lambeth MS. 306 and other
                sources.
EETS
         o.s. 15 (1866); repr. 1962; rev. ed. 1903: 141.

CamJes56.First Lines:
[U]Pon a cros nailed I was for theSuffredith deth to pay þi
                    raunson…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…Nowe for þi modirs meeke meditacionAt hir request to vs
                    be merciable
CamJes56.Attributed Title:
Oracio ad Crucem (f. 70v); In cruce sum pro te qui
                        peccas… (Latin heading for first stanza (f.
                    70v)

BLAdd5465.Note: With 10-line burden; Greene identifies music as Sheryngham

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
Vpon the crosse nayled I was for thesoferyd deth to pay thy
                    raunsome…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…now for thy moders meke medytacionat her request be to vs
                    merciable
BLAdd29729.Note:
Four stanzas only (1-3, 5), without 10-line burden; ends ‘Amen /
                    finis’ (f. 131v), by scribe (John Stow).

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
Vppon the crosse y nayled was for theSuffred deth to pay þy
                    raunsome
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Now for thy modras meke mediaciounAt her Request be to vs
                    merciable
BlCottCalAII.Note:
Ends ‘Amen’ at end of last line and ‘Explicit’
                    by scribe in lower margin, f. 134v.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Wuinque wlnera (in upper margin f. 134v); Quinque
                        vulnera quinque Gaudia (f. 1, sixteenth-century list of contents
                    encompassing 1713 as well)

BLHar2255.First Lines:
Upon a cros nayled I was for theSuffryd deth to pay thy
                    raunsoun…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…Now for thy moodris meek meditaciounAt hir request be to vs
                    merciable Explicit

BLHar5396.First Lines: Vpon þe cros naylyd I was for þeSuffrud deth to pay þy rawnsom…
BLHar5396.Last Lines: …Now for þy moderys us meke medyationAt hur request be to us meryable
BLHar5396.Note: In penultimate line, “us” written before “meke” and crossed through; in last line, “c” missing from “mercyable”: ends “Explicit.”
BLHar5396.Attributed Title: Our Lordys Exhortacyon (added to upper margin by a later hand, f. 294)

HunHM140.First Lines:
Vpponne a crosse nayled I am for theSuffryng deth to pay thy
                    rawnsomme…
HunHM140.Last Lines:
…Now for thy moders meke meditacionAtte request of her to vs
                    be mercyable
HunHM140.Note:
Six stanzas; preceded by Latin, ‘In cruce sum pro te qui peccas
                        desine pro me / Desine do ueniam dic culpam retraho
                    penam’
